Health.headline: The biggest pushup mistakes that make them useless
Health.summary: Common mistakes made during pushups can render the exercise ineffective and even lead to injury. Understanding and correcting these errors is crucial for maximizing the benefits of this foundational strength-building movement.
key_points: Many people make pushup mistakes that reduce effectiveness.
Incorrect form can lead to injury and minimize benefits.
Correcting these errors is crucial for optimal results.

Health.headline: 5 vegetables that are healthier raw than cooked
Health.summary: Certain vegetables retain more nutritional value when consumed raw rather than cooked due to the preservation of heat-sensitive vitamins and enzymes. Incorporating these five vegetables uncooked can enhance one's diet and provide maximum health benefits.
key_points: Five specific vegetables are healthier raw than cooked.
Raw consumption preserves heat-sensitive vitamins and enzymes.
Incorporating them uncooked can boost dietary nutrition.

Health.headline: China's new 'condom tax' prompts scepticism, fear over health risks
Health.summary: China's introduction of a new 'condom tax' has met with widespread skepticism and raised fears over potential public health risks. Critics worry that the tax could discourage condom use, leading to increased rates of STIs and unintended pregnancies.
key_points: China implemented a new 'condom tax'.
The tax is met with skepticism and concerns about public health.
Critics fear it could increase STIs and unintended pregnancies.

Health.headline: Vegetarian and vegan diets can be healthy for kids, study finds
Health.summary: A new study has concluded that well-planned vegetarian and vegan diets can be perfectly healthy and nutritionally adequate for children. This research provides reassurance for parents considering plant-based diets for their families, emphasizing the importance of proper meal planning.
key_points: Study confirms well-planned vegetarian/vegan diets are healthy for children.
The research reassures parents opting for plant-based diets.
Proper meal planning is key for nutritional adequacy in kids.

Health.headline: Slow tapering and therapy can help people quit antidepressants: study
Health.summary: A recent study suggests that a gradual reduction (tapering) of antidepressants combined with therapy can effectively help individuals discontinue medication. This approach offers a safer and more supported pathway for those seeking to cease antidepressant use, minimizing withdrawal symptoms.
key_points: Gradual tapering of antidepressants, combined with therapy, aids cessation.
This method offers a safer way to discontinue medication.
It helps minimize withdrawal symptoms for individuals.
